newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain Treasury sees saving on '97 interest payouts.
newsitem.headline: Spain Treasury sees saving on '97 interest payouts.

text.p: Spain will save between 120 and 130 billion pesetas this year in interest payments because of the fall in yields since September, Federico Ferrer, deputy director of external funding at the Spanish Treasury, said at a seminar on Wednesday.
He added that while Spain is likely to issue the same amount of peseta debt in 1997 as it did in 1996, it might issue more in the foreign market.

Ferrer, addressing a Euromoney conference, said the 1997 total issue would be around 0.7 trillion pesetas in the foreign market, and around 14 trillion pesetas in the domestic market denominated in pesetas.

Ferrer said although the perspective of European economic and monetary union would make it more convenient for Spain to issue only short-term debt, the state will give the needed liquidity to every maturity in the market.
"The issuance will be distributed all along the Spanish yield curve," he said.
